title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5005.4 - Subscription application requirements
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5005.4 - Subscription application requirements

State Regulations
(a) Rejection of application. A subscription application may be
rejected for any of the following reasons: (1)
all information required by the
commission is not provided; (2)
the
application includes a form of payment that is not acceptable to the commission
or the form of payment is rejected; (3)
the applicant is under 18 years of
age; (4)
the applicant's identity
cannot be verified; (5)
the
applicant's physical location cannot be identified at time of attempted
purchase; (6)
the applicant's
physical location is outside the State or any commission-designated prohibited
sales area at time of attempted purchase; or
(7)
the applicant is on the commission's
voluntary self-exclusion list. (b) Termination. A
subscription may be terminated after acceptance if, before or after the start
date, the commission is notified that the payment for the subscription is
invalid (e.g., a payment returned for non-sufficient funds). In such event, the
subscription shall be deemed invalid, and no prizes will be paid to the
applicant relating to any period in which the subscription was
invalid. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5005.4

comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
